title: How to write 'hello world' in HEXO (I)
content:
What is HEXO?HEXO is a very famous and useful web framework. People always combine HEXO with GitHub to bulid their own blogs or webpages.
InstallFirst of all, you need to install node.js, you can refer to its website here, and git, you can refer here.
After configuration, you are supposed to install HEXO via node.js command called npm.
npm install -g hexo-cli

InitializeOnce HEXO is installed, run the following commands to initialize HEXO in the target <folder>.
hexo init <folder>  # initcd <folder>npm install         # install other dependency

Once initialized, here’s what your project folder will look like:
.├── _config.yml         # user can config settings here├── package.json        # record dependency etc.├── scaffolds           # define three post methods -- post, draft and page├── source              # store your posts and other resources|   ├── _drafts|   └── _posts└── themes              # user's custom themes

ConfigurationIn _config.yml file, you can stylize your own settings. For example:

title – your website’s name
url – the URL of your website

you can find more details here.
Commandnewhexo new [layout] [-p/--path filePath] <title>

Creates a new article. If no [layout] is provided, Hexo will use the default_layout from _config.yml. 
By default, Hexo will use the title to define the path of the file. For page, it will create a directory of that name and an index.md file in it. Use the –path option to override that behaviour and define the file path:
hexo new page --path about/me "About"
will create source/about/me.md file with the title “About” set in the front matter.
For post, it will automatically generate a new file in source/_posts/<title>.md
serverhexo serverhexo s
Run a local server.
generatehexo g
Generate static files, which means it will convert/render .md or .ejs files to html files.
cleanhexo clean

Cleans the cache file (db.json) and generated files (public).
deployhexo d

Deploy your files to remote server. You can set your deploy destination:

open _config.yml
configure depoly area, for example, if you want to deploy your website in GitHubdeploy:    type: git    repository: https://github.com/xxx/xxx.github.io.git    branch: master

title: How-to-write-hello-world-in-HEXO-II
content:
Post your fileNow, you can begin to write your markdown or ejs files. When you want to post a file, you can just run codes in orders.

hexo new post <fileName>
write something
hexo clean
hexo g
hexo d

Front-matterWhen you new a file, HEXO will automatically generate a file in certain format, it depends on your METHOD (like post, draft and page) in scaffolds.
For POST METHOD, it will generate a file with beginning below:
---title: <fileName>date: <createTime>---

In HEXO, the beginning area which surrounded by --- is HEXO’s syntax. title represents the file’s title, and data represents the create time. 
For instance, when we use below Front-matter, we can get corresponding webpage.
---title: HELLOdate: 2021-04-19---<main>

<h1>HELLO</h1>[Username] <span>2021-04-19</span> <main>


categories & tagsExcept title and date, there are many other key words:

categories – indicates the categories it belongs to
tags – indicates the tags it has

Notice: categories is different with tags. tags is unordered, while categories is ordered.
---title: date:categories:- Web- HEXOtags:- web- hexo---

This file will be attached tags with “web” and “hexo”, these tags are parallel. However, it also will be archived to Web and HEXO, and Web is father category, HEXO is child category.


If you want to assign many father-child categories, you can use []
categories:- [Web, HEXO]- [Web, Framework]

title: hexo-pdf
content:
If you want to insert .pdf files in your HEXO pages, there are two methods.

METHOD 0

You can install HEXO package hexo-pdf.
npm install --save hexo-pdf

Then, you can use .ejs syntax {% pdf path %} to achieve function.
{% pdf https://drive.google.com/xxx %}  # external url{% pdf ./xxx.pdf %}                     # file path


METHOD 1

In your index.md, you can use html syntax to achieve this function.
<object data="https://drive.google.com/xxx" type="application/pdf" width="100%" height="100%"><object data="./xxx.pdf" type="application/pdf" width="100%" height="100%">


You can adjust the width and height even other properties.
